metadata.title: CVE-2017-13064 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
GraphicsMagick 1.3.26 has a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in thefunction GetStyleTokens in coders/svg.c:311:12.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-13064` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.26-7
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.26-7
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.26-7
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.26-7
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.26-7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.26-7').
